name: Double Dealing Illusionists
description:
[The game is available on HTML and Window]

Main Mechanic: The light mage leaves crystals on tiles went through and destroys it if it is already there. The dark mage will see these crystals as solid blocks, helping in an ice-sliding puzzle. The opposite is true for the dark orb of the dark mage.

SETTINGS "Double Dealing Illusionists", as the name implies, is a game where you control two different characters (a light mage and a dark prophet) to descend the dungeon together. The magic the mage casts and be seen as a barrier to the prophet, and vice versa. This creates an illusional path for them to move through the dungeon safely. However, since they two share the same fate (i.e one dies if another does), you have to help them maneuver their path so that they can avoid dead-ends.

DDI is a simple ice-sliding puzzle topdown game, in which you "slide" instead of moving. This is the biggest motivation for you to use the complementary power of these two characters to illuminate a path.

CONTROLS
  • WASD or Arrow keys: Slide
  • Space: Switch character
  • Mouse: Interact with GUI

Puzzle-solving has never been my flair, but in this case, I took risks creating puzzles that are both intuitive and challenging (hopefully not too frustrating). I already solved them, but not in the minimum number of moves.

Can you prove me wrong? Then solve these 9 stages in an even smaller number of steps than I did!

CREDITS
  • This is my second time participating in the GTMK jam (and this time as a solo developer), and I still honestly have much to learn (please be critical to me if possible).
  • Still, I'm very proud of what I have made in this jam, compared to the previous entry I have already grown a lot.
  • Programming + Sound effect: me
  • Music: FesliyanStudio and Pixel Beats
  • Art: free assets from Itch.io
